alert.note: Alert for Ellis (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 26 at 4:59AM CDT until October 26 at 5:15AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Texas, including the following counties, Ellis and Kaufman. * WHEN...Until 800 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Waxahachie, Ennis, Crandall, Palmer, Combine, Italy, Bardwell, Grays Prairie, Alma, Cottonwood, Bardwell Lake, Garrett, Milford, Scurry, Bristol, Rosser, Boyce, Reagor Springs, Crisp and Howard.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
